content.description: Sit start at the left end of a horizontal seam that gently trends up and right. The seam has a blank bulge/wave above it. Traverse to the right on thin fingers and compact feet. Top out through the dirty notch.
content.location: From the first crag where Hybrid is, walk along the cliff outcropping for about 200' to find this problem.

content.description: Sit start on the large feature under the bulge, close to the ground, between Hybrid and Unnamed Corner. Move up and left into the hand crack. Follow it around the corner, and top out.
content.location: Start on the obvious, large feature under the bulge about 6-feet right of Hybrid.

content.description: Sit start at the lowest point below the open book corner. Follow the crack up into the corner with triangular pockets, and top out through the notch.
content.location: It is about 10' right of Hybrid.

content.description:
Sit start the obvious finger crack. It is only about 6 moves, but it packs a punch requiring technical feet, hybrid locks/laybacks, and sustained grace.

 This was likely done as a 2-move stand start back-in-the-day. I cleaned loose chunks of stone from inside the crack down low that would've had to come out for anyone to pull up into this from the sit. It's a pure sit start.
content.location: It is on the left side of the first real crag you come to walking down the road.

content.description: This is a 10'-15' high, overhung, granite cliff band alongside the gated off portion of Crooked Lane. In October 2018, there was a puddle near the base. This cliff may only be climbable for a short period of time each year. Expect bugs/swamp conditions in summer, ice in the winter, and pooling water in the spring. There are some very hard looking lines on some of these overhung faces.
